meanings.sent1: The cranked handle made the music box play a sweet melody.
meanings.sent2: The cranked knob adjusted the volume of the radio.
meanings.sent3: She cranked the toy car's wheels, making it zoom across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The cranked lid of the jar finally opened after much effort.
meanings.sent5: The cranked lever controlled the movement of the machine.

meanings.sent1: He felt cranked when his plans were suddenly changed.
meanings.sent2: She became cranked after waiting in line for too long.
meanings.sent3: The cranked customer complained about the slow service.
meanings.sent4: The cranked expression on his face showed his frustration.
meanings.sent5: The cranked tone of her voice revealed her impatience.

meanings.sent1: The cranked flashlight needed manual power to work.
meanings.sent2: The cranked music box played a nostalgic tune.
meanings.sent3: He used the cranked pencil sharpener to sharpen his pencil.
meanings.sent4: The cranked generator provided electricity during the outage.
meanings.sent5: The cranked toy car required winding up to move.

meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he felt a bit cranked.
meanings.sent2: She seemed cranked after smoking with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The cranked partygoers danced wildly to the music.
meanings.sent4: He acted cranked at the concert, laughing at everything.
meanings.sent5: The cranked group of friends giggled uncontrollably at the jokes.
